caption: The Pierre et Marie Curie campus of Sorbonne University is an exceptional blend of architectural intelligence and academic excellence. Its matrix-like corridor system creates a seamless navigation experience, allowing you to easily move across the campus. This thoughtful design maximizes both space and functionality, making it intuitive for students, faculty, and visitors alike.  Beyond the intelligent architecture, this campus fosters an extraordinary educational and research community. Offering one of the best curriculums in Europe, Sorbonne University consistently attracts top talent and provides cutting-edge learning opportunities. Whether you're pursuing undergraduate studies or advanced research, the resources and faculty support are unparalleled.  The vibrant campus life is another major highlight. From academic events to social gatherings and student-led activities, there is always something happening that enriches your experience. The balance between scholarly activities and fun social events, including parties and networking opportunities, makes student life here both exciting and rewarding. It’s the perfect environment for those looking to build not just an academic career, but a memorable and fulfilling student experience.  Highly recommended for anyone seeking a world-class education in a dynamic, supportive, and architecturally impressive environment!
I was a master student here, beautiful campus, famous professors, difficult exams... lots of unforgettable memories.
Favourite Place to study and discover a good campus for students in science. There are 7 different libraries with so many topics

Probably the best university in paris. In 2014 Academic Ranking of World Universities it got first ranking in France and sixth in Europe. It has near about 100,000 students from all over the world. The university is situated on the Jussieu campus.  It is the largest scientific university in France with current QS World university Ranking 131. It has hundreds of scientific laboratories. It also produced many Nobel Laureates.

Huge university campus which includes, among others, the Jussieu University of Sciences, recognizable by its 1950s-style architecture but renovated and modernized during asbestos removal work a few years ago. It occupies an entire block of buildings, right next to the Institut du Monde Arabe, and can be seen from the Quai de Seine between Bastille and Île Saint-Louis. You can also see its library from the outside and it seems huge. It remains to study there to be able to appreciate it, as well as to judge the teaching, the possibility of traveling there and the information (registration dates, timetables, etc.); because the campus is monitored, like most Parisian universities, and it is better to show your credentials (your student card)... Unless it is possible to visit it on special days like those of Heritage?
Large campus with active community life and good teaching and many libraries available, negative points the overloaded university restaurant and the administration not always at the top

Pierre and Marie Curie University (UPMC), now part of Sorbonne University, presents striking architecture, the result of the vision of several architects. The campus was designed by architect Roger Taillibert in the 1960s and is distinguished by its bold shapes and concrete structures. The UPMC tower, reaching 27 floors, houses research laboratories and sits in the middle of the composition.  The interior spaces, designed by architect Jean-Claude Bétemps, promote natural light, creating an atmosphere conducive to study. The site is also enriched by landscape elements, integrating nature into the urban environment. The whole aims to encourage interaction and innovation between students and researchers, while being part of a sustainable approach.
We visited the mineralogy museum which is absolutely magnificent. A very beautiful collection and a very affordable entry price.
